intro: Elaeodendron aethiopicum, commonly known as the African olive, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its narrow, dark green leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is encased in a hard, woody coating. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
